abstracts.cdata!:
The Technical Assistance Project,
            complementing proposed but separate assistance from the
            Kuwait Fund, would strengthen the capabilities of the
            Central Planning Organization. It would achieve this by
            national economic planning and public investment
            programming, project evaluation and monitoring as well as
            developing and maintaining a national data bank. More
            specifically, it would: (a) provide on-the-job and overseas
            training for selected staff in key General Departments of
            CPO; (b) ensure greater coordination and complementarity
            between the General Departments, and between the CPO and
            other ministries/agencies. It would; (c) introduce improved
            procedures in economic planning and investment programming,
            project processing and cost control, and in reviewing
            contract documentation, management of technical assistance
            as well as improved procurement practices. Finally, the
            project would; (d) ensure a well-managed and organized
            central data processing capability in YAR. The project would
            finance about 13 staff-years of specialists' services
            and about 27 staff-years of overseas fellowship training;
            English language training, mainly in-country, for about 16
            CPO staff; and office and data processing equipment.
